data.title: When does USA men's basketball play? How to watch USA vs Brazil in Olympics quarterfinal matchup
data.meta_description: The United States men's basketball team is on to the knockout round. Here's how to watch Team USA's quarterfinal matchup vs. Brazil in 2024 Olympics.
data.text:
The heavily favored Team USA men's basketball program begins the knockout round with a matchup against Brazil in the quarterfinals.

Led by LeBron James, Steph Curry, Kevin Durant and company, the United States dominated pool play, going undefeated in all three games and winning by by 17 or more points in each Group C matchup versus Serbia, South Sudan and most recently, Puerto Rico on Saturday.

The final eight teams that have a chance to win the gold medal are: United States, France, Germany, Canada, Greece, Serbia, Australia and aforementioned Brazil.

If the U.S. does advance past Brazil as expected, they'll await the winner of Serbia versus Australia on Thursday.

On the injury front, Team USA got positive news as Jrue Holiday, who was unable to suit up against Puerto Rico due to an ankle injury, will play versus Brazil on Tuesday according to multiple reports.

With the knockout round starting early Tuesday morning, here's everything you need to know for how to watch, stream, odds and more for Team USA men's basketball vs. Brazil:

What time, channel is Team USA men's basketball vs Brazil?

The United States and Brazil will wrap up the quarterfinal action on Tuesday afternoon with the game airing at 3:30 p.m. eastern time on NBC, USA Network, NBCOlympics.com and streaming on Peacock.

If you don't have cable or access to the channels where the Olympics will be broadcast on (NBC, USA Network, CNBC, Golf Channel and E!), there's no need to worry as FuboTV currently offers a free, seven-day trial to new subscribers of the streaming service.

How to stream 2024 Olympics

The 2024 Olympics will be streaming all their coverage on two platforms, Peacock and NBCOlympics.com.

Streaming Olympics 2024: How to watch 2024 Paris Olympics with a Peacock subscription

USA men's basketball, medal round schedule for 2024 Olympics

If the United States does indeed move on, they'll play their semifinals opponent on Thursday, Aug. 8 at either 11:30 a.m. or 3 p.m. eastern time.

Here's the full schedule from the quarterfinal matchups all the way through the medal round this weekend (all times eastern):

Quarterfinals

Tuesday, Aug. 6: Germany vs. Greece, airing at 5 a.m. on E!, Peacock, and NBCOlympics.com

Tuesday, Aug. 6: Serbia vs. Australia, airing at 8:30 a.m. on USA Network, Peacock, and NBCOlympics.com

Tuesday, Aug. 6: France vs. Canada, airing at 12 p.m. on Peacock and NBCOlympics.com

Tuesday: Aug. 6: Team USA vs. Brazil, airing at 3:30 p.m. on USA Network, Peacock, and NBCOlympics.com

Semifinals

Thursday, Aug. 8: TBD vs. TBD, airing at11:30 a.m. on USA Network, Peacock, and NBCOlympics.com

Thursday, Aug. 8: TBD vs. TBD, airing at 3 p.m. on USA Network, Peacock, and NBCOlympics.com

Medal round

Saturday, Aug. 10 - Bronze medal game: 5 a.m. airing on USA Network, Peacock, and NBCOlympics.com

Saturday, Aug. 10 - Gold medal game: 3:30 p.m. airing on NBC, Peacock, and NBCOlympics.com

USA men's basketball vs. Brazil odds for Tuesday's game

Team USA begins the knockout round as a 26.5-point favorite against Brazil on Tuesday.

The United States has been massive favorites in each of their first three games -- but despite massive victories -- failed to cover the spread in their final two contests against the spread versus South Sudan and Puerto Rico.

As expected, the U.S. is a again a big favorite this time versus Brazil, who has the longest odds of winning the gold medal in Paris at +50000 odds (500/1).

Here's the current odds for the spread and total on FanDuel Sportsbook in New Jersey in this Group C finale between Team USA and Brazil:

Spread: USA -26.5 (-106), Brazil +26.5 (-114)

Total: Over 185.5 points (-114), under 185.5 points (-106)

Moneyline: USA (-20000), Brazil (30/1)
